iipax.generic.plugin.broker.PushPlugin.name: iipax.business.jmsgw.JmsGatewayPushPlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.PushPlugin.description: shs plugin used to push messages. Messages are pushed to JMS-queue determined by RTL-configuration. Only messages containing one datapart is supported. If message should not be of default JMS style a plugin to format JMS-message can be configured in RTL.

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.PushPlugin.name: iipax.business.lta.plugin.LtaPushPlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.PushPlugin.description: Plugin used to archive SIP's in the LTA. Only supports ancient way of LTA communication, i e message should contain a single data part that uses multi part mime format with SIP label in the first position, followed by the associated files.

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.PushPlugin.name: iipax.business.lta.plugin.ws.OrderDipPushPlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.PushPlugin.description: This is the web-service endpoint for the OrderDIP operation, implemented as a push plugin.

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.PushPlugin.name: iipax.service.brokerkernel.fileintegration.plugin.PushToFtp
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.PushPlugin.description: Push plugin that transfers the data parts of a message to an FTP server.

Dir.description: Target path at the FTP server. Must already exist. This string may contain any acronyms handled by AcronymSubstitutor. Default value: . (ie current directory).

Mkdir.description: Target path to create at the FTP server. This string may contain any acronyms handled by AcronymSubstitutor. Note that if setDir is also used, mkdir is considered relative to that value. Empty by default.

Mode.description: Connection mode. Valid values: active, passive. Default value: active.

Type.description: File transfer type. Valid values: binary, ascii. Default value: binary.

File.description: File name pattern. This string may contain any acronyms handled by AcronymSubstitutor, in addition to these also allows %DP and %OF for data part number and original file name. Default value: %OF.

SiteCommand.description: Optional list of site (server) specific commands that should be invoked before the file(s) are transferred. Each command must be separated with the # character. Example:umask 000#help

Unique.description: If true, existing files on the server will not be overwritten. In these cases, the new file gets a unique file name, decided by the receiving ftp server.

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.PushPlugin.name: iipax.service.brokerkernel.fileintegration.plugin.PushToVfs
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.PushPlugin.description: Push plugin that stores the dataparts of a message to a file system. The destination URI is parsed by {@link AcronymSubstitutor} so supported acronyms will be expanded.

SendLabel.description: Sets the setSendLabel, default is true

Uri.description: The URI where the data parts will be pushed to.

Binary.description: true for binary, false for ASCII

Decrypt.description: Specifies whether encrypted dataparts should be decrypted or not. Optional, if not specified, encrypted dataparts will be decrypted.

File.description: File name pattern. This string may contain any acronyms handled by AcronymSubstitutor, in addition to these also allows %DP and %OF for data part number and original file name. Default value: %OF.

UserDirIsRoot.description: true if the user directory is the root directory

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.PushPlugin.name: iipax.service.brokerkernel.plugin.FtpPushPlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.PushPlugin.description: Push plugin that writes data parts to an FTP server.

Host.description: the address of the FTP server.

User.description: the user name to connect as.

Pwd.description: the password of the user to connect as.

Dir.description: the remote directory to transfer files to.

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.PushPlugin.name: iipax.service.brokerkernel.plugin.WebServicePushPlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.PushPlugin.description: Plugin that calls a web service. If the message has more than one data part, the XOP format will be used, otherwise an ordinary SOAP Envelope is created. An SSEK header can be included by setting the parameter includeSsekHeader to true. Example: iipax.service.brokerkernel.plugin.WebServicePushPlugin url=http://foo.com/service123 includeSsekHeader=true soapVersion=1.1

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.OnlinePlugin.name: iipax.business.jmsgw.JmsGatewayOnlinePlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.OnlinePlugin.description: The JmsGatewayOnlinePlugin is an shs-plugin used to handle synchronous requests. Synchronous requests are put on an JMS-queue. The plugin will then poll another queue for replies. A reply must contain the same correlation id as the request. The reply is then returned to the shs. The online-plugin itself can execute plugins to read and write JMS-messages. Even if not standard JMS-messages is used, the JMS-property correlation id must be set! Only replies with correct correlation id property will be fetched from reply queue!

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.OnlinePlugin.name: iipax.service.brokerkernel.plugin.FileDownloadOnlinePlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.OnlinePlugin.description: Synchronous plugin to download the attached file from MTS using transaction id. It also changes the status of the message to "levererad" by fetching it. Send HTTP GET to http://[rest.mt.url]/auto/[tx-id]/[file name] The chosen file name will not affect the behaviour of this plugin. It's purpose is to allow external tools to save the file with the name used. Path 'auto' is configurable with setPathName.

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.OnlinePlugin.name: iipax.service.brokerkernel.plugin.ListFileNamesOnlinePlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.OnlinePlugin.description: Synchronous plugin to return transaction id's and filenames from MTS with the specified product type and the current receiver. Only returns messages with status "f√§rdig" if includeDelivered is not configured. Call with http://[rest.mt.url]/auto/rest/[product id]?getfilenames=true Using getfilenames=false or no query at all returns a list of txId without the filenames.

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.OnlinePlugin.name: iipax.service.brokerkernel.plugin.XmlSchemaValidateOnlinePlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.OnlinePlugin.description: Online plugin that validates the input against an XML Schema. If the input passes the validation, the specified online plugin is called.

JsonKey.description: Sets the text to write to the out stream. should be in json format to match the Content-Type used by the plugin. If not set then no text will be written

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.OnlinePlugin.name: iipax.service.shsbroker.plugin.ForwardingOnlinePlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.OnlinePlugin.description: Forwards a message to another node.

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.OnlinePlugin.name: iipax.service.ssekbroker.plugin.SsekOnlinePlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.OnlinePlugin.description: This broker online plugin can be used for internal delivery of synchronous SSEK-messages.

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.SynchronousP.name: iipax.business.lta.plugin.ws.ArchiveSipSynchPlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.SynchronousP.description: Plugin used to synchronously archive SIP's in the LTA. Supports the preferred way of LTA communication, i e message should contain SIP label in the first data part, followed by associated files in separate data parts. The SIP label must use xop references to connect file content.

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.SynchronousP.name: iipax.business.lta.plugin.ws22.OrderDipFastSyncPlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.SynchronousP.description: This is the web-service endpoint for the OrderDIPFast operation, implemented as a synchronous plugin ({@link SynchronousPlugin}).

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.SynchronousP.name: iipax.service.brokerkernel.iip.test.TestXmlParserPlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.SynchronousP.description: Test plugin that tries to parse to message content as XML.

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.SynchronousP.name: iipax.service.brokerkernel.plugin.MailSynchPlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.SynchronousP.description: Synchronous plugin that sends broker messages as e-mails.

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.SynchronousP.name: iipax.service.brokerkernel.ws.security.plugin.GetResourcesPermissionsPlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.SynchronousP.description: Plugin that handles the GetResourcesPermissions web service. The web service is invoked with a username and a service id and should respond with all permissions the given user has in that service.

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.SynchronousP.name: iipax.service.casekernel.plugin.ws.SearchRecordEventsSynchPlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.SynchronousP.description: Plugin to perform synchronous search for record events.

Partition.description: The partition to perform searches in.

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.SynchronousP.name: iipax.service.iwa.registry.GetConfigurationStructureValuePlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.SynchronousP.description: Plugin for getting structured configuration values

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.ValidatePlug.name: iipax.business.lta.plugin.ws.ReflectiveSipValidatePlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.ValidatePlug.description:
Validation plugin that returns the receipt of an asynchronous web service. In an earlier version, it was implemented with reflection. The name and parameter is kept for configuration compatibility reasons. The responseClass parameter should be set to the class representing the response element. Valid values are:
  • *.ValidateSipAsynchResponse
  • *.ArchiveSipAsynchResponse
  • *.OrderDipResponse
(the package doesn't matter).

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.ValidatePlug.name: iipax.service.brokerkernel.plugin.ReturnTxIdValidationPlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.ValidatePlug.description: Validation plugin that returns txID from MTS of the sent message.

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.ValidatePlug.name: iipax.service.brokerkernel.plugin.SignatureValidatePlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.ValidatePlug.description: Validation plugin for signature verification. Calls the {@link SignatureCheckServiceImpl} to verify that the signature is correct for the signed data.

Data.description: Which data part that contains the signed data

Signature.description: Which data part that contains the signature

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.ValidatePlug.name: iipax.service.brokerkernel.plugin.XmlValidationPlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.ValidatePlug.description:
Validation plugin for xml files. Xml files must specify a grammar and ar checked against the dtd. An argument mimeparts should specify which mimeparts to validate.
Example of rtl rule: iipax.service.brokerkernel.plugin.XmlValidationPlugin config=1 config=3

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.RegisterPlug.name: iipax.business.shsarchive.plugin.FileArchivePlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.RegisterPlug.description: Default message archive plugin. This plugin will archive messages (store them in a file system), and possibly sign and timestamp them.

Origin.description: This parameter is copied to originator in the SHS message sent to archive.

LtaRootNode.description: Method for specifying the LTA root node for all LTA messages, i.e. the first container element in the StoragePath element in Index Object

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.FormatPlugin.name: iipax.service.brokerkernel.plugin.CharsetConverterFormatPlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.FormatPlugin.description: Converts the the character encoding in a data part from one type to another. Can also substitute one character (or a pair) with another character (or a pair). Useful e.g to convert line ending characters.

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.FormatPlugin.name: iipax.service.brokerkernel.plugin.RemoveDataPartFormatPlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.FormatPlugin.description: Simple format plugin that removes the specified data parts from a message.

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.FormatPlugin.name: iipax.service.iwa.contact.TransformCommentToMail
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.FormatPlugin.description: Transforms a {@link SendCommentType} message into a message that could be sent via mail. The plugin argument 'fromEmailAddress' and 'toEmailAddress' MUST be set in order for this plugin to work. The argument 'subject' is optional and can be set to adjust the subject of the mail.

iipax.generic.plugin.broker.FormatPlugin.name: iipax.service.ssekbroker.plugin.XOPFormatPlugin
iipax.generic.plugin.broker.FormatPlugin.description: This plugin converts an SSEK XOP mime message to an SSEK soap message
